name: StrongHearts Native Helpline
description: A 24/7 confidential and anonymous culturally-appropriate domestic, dating, and sexual violence helpline for Native Americans. They offer peer support, advocacy, safety planning, crisis intervention, and referrals to Native-centered service providers
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Pennsylvania consultation

name: Native Connections Suicide Prevention and Awareness
description: Offers a 24/7 crisis line for Native people by calling 988 and choosing option 4, connecting to an all-Native team familiar with historical trauma and traditional elements. Texting "NATIVE" to 741741 also connects to a trained crisis counselor
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Pennsylvania consultation

name: All Nations Hotline
description: A crisis text line for Native Americans, staffed by Native Americans. Text "SUPPORT" to 33464 for assistance. Their hours are 8:00 am - 12:00 am CST, Monday-Sunday
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Pennsylvania consultation

name: Indigenous Community Health - Widoktadwen Center for Native Knowledge
description: Offers community health support for the local Indigenous community, including resources for tobacco-free living and assistance with health insurance through Pennie. They can be contacted via email at amanda@widoktadwen.org for assistance with Indigenous health and wellness
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Pennsylvania consultation

name: Native American Elder Justice Initiative (Pennsylvania Resources)
description: While not a direct service provider, this initiative lists tribal hotlines and state hotlines dedicated to addressing elder abuse, neglect, and exploitation within Native communities in Pennsylvania. Examples include hotlines for the Eagle Medicine Band of Cherokee Indians (1-215-391-5783) and Eastern Delaware Nations (1-570-924-9082)
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Pennsylvania consultation

name: First Nations Behavioral Health Association (FNBHA)
description: This organization provides national leadership for Native American behavioral health services. For immediate emergencies, they direct individuals to the 988 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline or the Crisis Text Line by texting PA to 741741. They can be contacted for general inquiries during business hours
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Pennsylvania consultation

name: Native Counseling and Therapy (PA & WV)
description: Founded in 2021, this practice offers integrative mental health care, including counseling services that focus on identifying and treating root causes of illness. They incorporate wellness practices and evidence-based complementary therapies. Their services are available in Latrobe, PA, and Morgantown, WV
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Pennsylvania consultation

name: Psychology Today - Native American Therapists in Pennsylvania
description: Psychology Today's directory lists Native American therapists in Pennsylvania who may be equipped to address topics like historical trauma and cultural identity. These therapists may also incorporate Indigenous healing traditions
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Pennsylvania consultation

name: Zencare - Indigenous Therapists in Pennsylvania
description: Zencare's platform lists Indigenous therapists in Pennsylvania who specialize in various issues, including anxiety, depression, trauma, and generational trauma
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Pennsylvania consultation

name: Lenape Valley Foundation
address: Doylestown Outpatient Office: 500 North West Street, Doylestown, PA 18901; Bristol Outpatient Office: 499 Bath Road, Bristol, PA 19007
description: Lenape Valley Foundation provides a range of behavioral health crisis services, including those at the Bright Path Center, which offers acute, trauma-informed, person-centered care for mental health, drug and alcohol use, and intellectual disabilities. They have been serving the community for over 60 years
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Pennsylvania consultation
